intro: Cyclophorus madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar cyclophorus, is a unique plant species native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spiral-shaped leaves, which are arranged in a helical pattern around the stem. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its restricted habitat and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
